Even though the coronavirus is complicating our education process, Caldwell Schools is...

img.alt: Doe v. Ohio Department of Education Notice of Proposed Class Action Settlement

a.span: Doe v. Ohio Department of Education Notice of Proposed Class Action Settlement

div.p: Notice of Proposed Class Action Settlement
ATTN: Accepted Mid-East BUFFALO CAMPUS Students--- check your CHS email for details about course requests for the 20-21 school year.
Attention Senior Parents- details are listed below for the development of a tribute slide show for our Seniors.
Today’s Super Senior is Miss Makayla Rayner.
Parents: Trisha Rayner and Jason Rayner
Siblings: Devon Clark (20), Jason Rayner (15), Justin Rayner (13)
School: CCP program at Washington State Community College and she also takes classes through the high school
Activities: MaKayla enjoys traveling, art, spending time with her friends and family, the beach, and playing with her dog Cinder.
Future plans: MaKayla’s future plan is to attend Coastal Carolina University and graduate with her Master’s degree in forensic psychology.
Superpower: If she could have any superpower MaKayla would want to be able to teleport. That way she can travel anywhere she wants.

If you have a child coming to Kindergarten next fall, please call Caldwell Elementary @ 740-732-4614. The office will be open sporadically, but messages are checked daily, so please leave a message. Please leave your name, your child’s name and a phone number to reach you. We need approximate numbers to help us develop a plan for registration that is both productive & safe.

CALDWELL SCHOOLS 2020-2021 Open-Enrollment Application Window opened April 1
Even though the coronavirus is complicating our education process, Caldwell Schools is still moving
ahead in our planning for the 2020/2021 school year.
Caldwell Exempted Village School District will be accepting Open-Enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. Parents, if you live outside of our district boundaries AND would like your child/children to attend Caldwell Schools in 2020/2021, you need to complete an application for each child.
Applications are being collected in the Superintendent’s Office between April 1 and June 30, 2020.
During this time, due to the coronavirus and building closures, office hours are inconsistent. If you do have any questions, or need an application, please call the District Office at 740-732-5637 to leave your name and phone number or email Denitra Warner at dwarner@caldwell.k12.oh.us.

Caldwell Exempted Village School District
516 Fairground St
Caldwell, OH 43724
Phone: 740-732-5637

p.a: CEVSD IS NOW ACCEPTING OPEN ENROLLMENT FROM NOW TILL JUNE 30!
